subsections.title: Net-zero goal and strategy
text: Congo does not have a net zero goal or strategy

subsections.title: Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC)
text: The country has a conditional and unconditional nationally determined contribution to cut emissions under the Paris Agreement. The level of emission reductions will be: 39.88% in the conditional scenario and 17.09% in the unconditional scenario in 2025; 32.19% in the conditional scenario and 21.46% in the unconditional scenario in 2030. The targeted sectors are energy, agriculture, waste, and forests.

subsections.title: Fossil fuel phase-out policy
text: Congo does not have a fossil fuel phaseout policy.

subsections.title: Power policy
text: Congo does not have any clear policies on promoting renewable energy. There are no tenders specific to renewable energy.

subsections.title: Power prices and costs
text: Tariffs in the country are determined by consumption bands and prices are negotiated with the government, ensuring that tariffs reflect actual costs. Power prices are not subsidized by the government, but fossil fuels are.

subsections.title: Power market
text: Tariffs in the country are determined by consumption bands and prices are negotiated with the government, ensuring that tariffs reflect actual costs. Power prices are not subsidized by the government, but fossil fuels are.

subsections.title: Doing business and barriers
text: Congo’s national electrification rate is 48% and peak power sits at 550MW. The country is aiming for 95% access in urban areas and 60% access in rural areas as part of its sustainable development goals by 2030.

Independent power producers can sell to customers and are taxed at 1% of annual turnover, but the rules on interconnection are not clear. Offtaker risk is extremely high in Congo because the public national utility has been in a dire financial situation. The utility was not able to meet its payments, so was privatized in 2018. Congo’s grid is in need of maintenance, but there are no plans in place due to lack of resources.

subsections.title: EV market
text: The government has yet to implement any substantive policy support in this sector and the electric vehicle market remains at an early stage.

subsections.title: EV policy
text: The government has yet to implement any substantial policy support in the sector and the EV market remains at an early stage.

subsections.title: Doing business and barriers
text: The government has yet to implement any substantial policy support in the sector and the EV market remains at an early stage.

subsections.title: Buildings market
text: The government has yet to implement any substantive policy support in this sector and the low-carbon heat market remains at an early stage.
